member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase
member.summary: The base class for compression / decompression operations.
member.remarks:
This class is the base for ZipForge, TarForge, GzipForge and TgzForge classes. All public methods and properties are declared here. So if you want to create your own implementation of the archiver or compression class you should to inherite your class from this one.
Because of base class doesn`t have any information about real implementation of items included in the archive, some methods should be override in the inherited class.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.ChangeFilesAttr(System.String,System.IO.FileAttributes)
member.summary: Changes file attributes for the files stored within the current archive file.
member.remarks:
Call ChangeFilesAttr to change file attributes for files stored within the current archive file.
The parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. All files that meet will be processed.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.AddFiles
member.summary: Adds files to the archive specified by FileMasks and ExclusionMasks properties.
member.remarks:
Use AddFiles to add files to the open archive file. If you need to delete backupFileStream files, use MoveFiles() instead of AddFiles. If Options.Recurse is set to true, AddFiles will search files recursively.
AddFiles variant without parameters uses FileMasks, ExclusionMasks and Options.SearchAttr properties to specify search conditions and to exclude files from add operation.
If some errors occurs an exception will be raised. Write an OnProcessFileFailure event handler to perform your own error handling.
If you need to change the name of the added file, use or or or .
member.overloads: Adds files to the archive.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.AddFiles(System.String)
member.summary: Adds files specified by the parameter to the archive.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.
member.remarks:
Use AddFiles to add files to the open archive file. If you need to delete backupFileStream files, use instead of AddFiles. If .Recurse is set to true, AddFiles will search files recursively.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "C:\TEST\*.*" specifies all files in the C:\TEST directory. All files that meets fileMask and searchAttributes will be added to the archive.

The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "C:\TEST\*.*" specifies all files in the C:\TEST directory. All files that meets fileMask and searchAttributes will be added to the archive.
The searchAttributes parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.AddFromStream(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.overloads: Adds data stored in a stream to the archive.
member.summary: Adds data stored in a stream to the archive.
member.remarks:
Use AddFromStream to compress data stored in the Stream descendant object like FileStream or MemoryStream to the file inside the archive.
While using multiple AddFromStream calls within a single transaction, keep in mind that you may get an error if a stream object is destroyed before the call to the EndUpdate method. Please take into account that you should use separate stream objects for each AddFromStream call.
member.param: Specifies file name that will be used to store data from the Stream descendant object.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.AddFromStream(System.String,System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: Adds data stored at a specified position in the stream to the archive.
member.param: Specifies file name that will be used to store data from the Stream descendant object.
Determines starting position in stream for adding data to the archive.

remarks.para: Use AddFromStream to compress data stored in the Stream descendant object like FileStream or MemoryStream to the file inside the archive.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.AddFromStream(System.String,System.IO.Stream,System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary: Adds specified amount of data stored at a specified position in the stream to the archive.
member.param: Specifies file name that will be used to store data from the Stream descendant object.
Determines starting position in stream for adding data to the archive.
Count specifies size of the data in stream for adding to the archive.

remarks.para: Use AddFromStream to compress data stored in the Stream descendant object like FileStream or MemoryStream to the file inside the archive.
The position determines starting position in stream for adding data to the archive.

Count specifies size of the data in stream for adding to the archive. If count = 0 size of the data will be - position. If count > 0 then AddFromStream copies stream data to the internal memory stream before processing.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Begins a transaction for an open archive.
member.remarks:
Call BeginUpdate to start a group of operations called a transaction. All changes made by operations within single transaction can be saved by calling or cancelled by . BeginUpdate sets property to true.
Transaction system provides archive integrity like reliable database systems.
Any transaction must be finished before extracting or testing files. Otherwise exception will be raised.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.CancelUpdate
member.summary: Cancels all archive operations made after calling BeginUpdate.
member.remarks: Use CancelUpdate to rollback current transaction started by . CancelUpdate clears all archive modifications made after calling BeginUpdate. CancelUpdate sets property to false.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.CloseArchive
member.summary: Closes current archive file.
member.remarks:
Call CloseArchive to close current archive file. CloseArchive automatically finishes current transaction started by method and sets to false.
Call to create or open archive file.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.DeleteFiles(System.String,System.IO.FileAttributes,System.String)
member.summary: Deletes files stored within the archive and specified by , and parameters.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.
Specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.
Specifies files to be excluded from the delete operation.
member.remarks:
Use DeleteFiles to delete files from the open archive file. If .Recurse is set to true, DeleteFiles will search files recursively.
DeleteFiles variant without parameters uses , and .SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from delete operation.
The parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. All files that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be deleted.
The parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.
The specifies files to be excluded from the delete operation.
If some errors occur an exception will be raised. Write an event handler to perform your own error handling.

member.summary: Finishes a transaction for an open archive.
member.remarks:
EndUpdate saves all archive modifications made after calling and finishes current transaction. EndUpdate sets property to false.
Call to cancel archive modifications.

member.summary: Extracts files specified by and parameters.

Attributes of the files to search for.
member.remarks: Use ExtractFiles to extract files from the open archive file. If .Recurse is set to true, ExtractFiles will search files recursively.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.ExtractFiles(System.String,System.IO.FileAttributes,System.String)
member.summary: Extracts files specified by , and parameters.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.
Attributes of the files to search for.
Specifies files to be excluded from the extract operation.
member.remarks:
Use ExtractFiles to extract files from the open archive file. If .Recurse is set to true, ExtractFiles will search files recursively.
ExtractFiles variant without parameters uses , and .SearchAttr properties to specify search conditions and to exclude files from add operation. ExtractFiles variant with parameters uses procedure parameters and ignores , and .SearchAttr properties.
The parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. All files that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be extracted from the archive. If FileMask is a blank string, no files will be extracted.
The parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.
The specifies files to be excluded from the extract operation.
Any transaction must be finished before calling ExtractFiles. Otherwise an exception will be raised. Also if some other errors occurs an exception will be raised. Write an event handler to perform your own error handling.
If you need to change the name of the extracted file, use or or or event handler.

member.remarks:

Any transaction must be finished before calling ExtractToBuffer. Otherwise an exception will be raised. Also if some other errors occurs an exception will be raised.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.FindFirst(ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiveItem@)
member.overloads: Finds files stored within the archive.
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using and properties.
member.remarks:
Use FindFirst and FindNext to find files stored inside the open archive file. FindFirst returns true if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
After calling FindFirst parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.
FindFirst variant with single parameter uses , and .SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from delete operation.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. First file that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be found.
The searchAttributes parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files
The exclusionMask specifies files to be excluded from the delete operation.
member.returns: true if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns false.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.TestFiles(System.String,System.IO.FileAttributes,System.String)
member.summary: Tests files stored within the archive using , and parameters.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.

Specifies files to be excluded from the test operation.
member.remarks:
Use TestFiles to test files stored within the open archive file. TestFiles will delete these temporary files after testing. If errors occurs during test operation event will be triggered. If there is no event handler available then exception will be raised. If .Recurse is set to true, TestFiles will search files recursively.
TestFiles variant without parameters uses , and .SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from test operation.
The parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. All files that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be tested.
The parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.
The specifies files to be excluded from the test operation.
Any transaction must be finished before calling TestFiles. Otherwise an exception will be raised. Also if some other errors occurs an exception will be raised. Write an event handler to perform your own error handling.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.FileCount
member.summary: Indicates the number of files in the archive file.
member.remarks:
Read FileCount at runtime to determine number of files within an archive file. The archive file must be opened before you can use this property. If the archive does not exist, create it using the method. Archive file is specified by the property.
This property is read-only.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.Size
member.summary: Indicates the size in bytes of the opened archive file.
member.remarks:
The archive file must be opened before you can use this property. If the archive does not exist, create it using the method. Archive file is specified by the property.
This property is read-only.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.InUpdate
member.summary: Indicates if an archive file is being updated.
member.remarks:
Use InUpdate property to determine if the archive file is being updated. Call if you need to force transaction system to complete current operation immediately.
This property is read-only.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.Exists
member.summary: Indicates whether the archive file exists.
member.remarks:
Read Exists at runtime to determine whether an archive file exists. If the archive does not exist, create it using the method. Archive file is specified by the property.
This property is read-only.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.Active
member.summary: Specifies whether or not an archive file is open.
member.remarks:
Use Active to determine if archive file is opened or to open it. When Active is false, the archive is closed. When Active is true, archive file management is available.
Setting Active to true:
Opens archive specified by the property
Triggers the AfterOpen event handler if one is defined for this component.
If an error occurs while opening the archive exception will be raised and archive file will be closed.
An application must set Active to false before creating new archive by calling with Create mode.
Calling the OpenArchive method sets Active to true; calling the method sets Active to false.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.BaseDir
member.summary: Specifies default path for archive operations.
member.remarks: When files are extracted from archive with all files and directories will be extracted to path specified by BaseDir. Also , and will use BaseDir as a default path to external files.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.ExclusionMasks
member.summary: Specifies files to be excluded from archive operations.
member.remarks:
ExclusionMasks are used for overloaded versions without parameters of , , , , and methods to exclude certain files for these operations. This property should contain list of excluded directories and file names including wildcard characters. For example, 'C:\TEST\*.*' specifies all files in the C:\TEST directory.
Three types of exclusion masks can be specified:
A mask for the whole BaseDir and all its sub-folders.
A mask for the BaseDir only.
A mask for an exact full path.
For example:
*.txt - exclude *.txt in the BaseDir and its sub-folders
\*.txt - exclude *.txt files in the BaseDir only
C:\The\Full\Path\*.txt - exclude the *.txt files only in the C:\The\Full\Path folder.
property specifies files that should be included into the operation, excluding files specified by ExclusionMasks.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.FileMasks
member.summary: Specifies files or wildcards for archiver operations.
member.remarks:
FileMasks are used for overloaded versions without parameters of , , , , and methods to select certain files for these operations. This property should contain list of directories and file names including wildcard characters. For example, "C:\\TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the C:\TEST directory.
FileMasks property specifies files that should be included into the operation, excluding files specified by .

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.FileName
member.summary: Specifies the archive file name.
member.remarks: Use FileName to specify the archive file before calling procedure.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverForgeBase.InMemory
member.summary: Indicates if an archive file is stored in memory.
member.remarks:
Indicates whether the current archive file is stored in memory (RAM). Set this property to true when you want to create a new or open an existing archive file in memory. If you set it to false file will be opened or created on disk, with the name defined by property. Setting InMemory to false when archive file is opened will cause writing the content of the archive file to disk. Set this property to true when you need to load content of the archive file into memory.
It is not recommended to set InMemory to true with large archive files. ZipForge.NET includes transaction system that optimizes the speed of archives updating.

Indicates the name of the file that will overwrite the existing file.
Indicates the name of the file being overwritten. Specify this parameter, if you want to save this file with a different name instead of overwriting the existing file.
Confirmation of the file overwriting. Set this parameter to false, if you want to cancel overwriting the existing file. The default value for the parameter is true.

member.summary: The delegate to handle the event.
member.param: The object whose event handler is being called.

members.member:
Gets or sets the comment to the item.
The comment to store for the item in the archive. Use this field to store some important information for the item. Stored string doesn`t influence to the algorithm or file format, it is used only for human consumption. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 18.05.2010 20:16

Indicates external file attributes.
File attributes.
If Options.SetAttributes is set to true then will set these attributes to the extracted file.
Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 18.05.2010 20:17

Gets or sets a value indicating whether header crc would be calculated and saved to the archive.
true if header crc value should be stored; otherwise, false.
Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 18.05.2010 20:17

Initializes a new instance of the class.
Name of the source file for new item. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 18.05.2010 20:19

Gets the compressed item size.
Compressed item size. This value is set by or by methods and indicates. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 18.05.2010 20:16

Gets the compression item rate.
The compression rate for the item. Compression rate calculate as percantage of saving because of compression file size to the uncompressed file size. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 18.05.2010 20:16

Gets the CRC for the data stream.
A cyclic redundancy check for the item. CRC value computed for the uncompressed data according to CRC-32 algorithm used in the ISO 3309 standard and stored immediatly after compressed data block. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 18.05.2010 20:17

Specific options for gzip archive.
Since a gzip archive can contains only one file, to add more files to the archive set property to true. In that case all files adding to the archive will be stored in separate files in the directory specified with . So all properties specified by this class would be of value only if property is set to true.
Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 18.05.2010 20:25

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.GZip.GzipForge.FindFirst(ComponentAce.Compression.GZip.GzipArchiveItem@)
member.overloads: Finds files stored within the archive.
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using and properties.
member.remarks:
Use and FindNext to find files stored inside the opened archive file. FindFirst returns true if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
After calling FindFirst parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.
FindFirst variant with single parameter uses , and .SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from delete operation.
member.returns: true if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns false.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.GZip.GzipForge.FindFirst(System.String,ComponentAce.Compression.GZip.GzipArchiveItem@)
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using parameter.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.
member.returns: true if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns false.
member.remarks:
Use FindFirst and to find files stored inside the open archive file. FindFirst returns true if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. First file that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be found.
After calling FindFirst archiveItem parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.

member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using and parameters.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.
Attributes of the files to search for.
member.returns: true if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns false.
member.remarks:
Use FindFirst and FindNext to find files stored inside the open archive file. FindFirst returns true if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
After calling FindFirst parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. First file that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be found.
The parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files

members.member:
Fires the event if it has any subscribers.
Specifies the archive item being added to the archive. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 27.06.2010 13:49

Gets or sets a value indicating whether to create separate archivers for each file.
true if you need to store each file in a separate archive; otherwise false.
Since GZip format doesnt support adding more than one file into archive, there can be some specific problems if you use method. If this property is set to false and you try to add more than one file by calling method, an exception will be thrown. But if you dont want the exception to be thrown, you can set the property to true. In that case the archiver will create several separate GZip archives, one per file each being archived.
The directory, where these separate archives will be located, is specified with the property .
Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 04.05.2010 14:13

Gets the gzip archive options.
Specifies the gzip options for archiving operations. Properties specified with the class would be of value only if is set to true.
Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 18.05.2010 21:10

member.name: E:ComponentAce.Compression.GZip.GzipForge.OnConfirmOverwriteOutputFile
member.summary: Occurs before an application overwrites the existing file.
member.remarks: Write the OnConfirmOverwriteOutputFile event handler to perform some specific actions before overwriting the file or to cancel it. The event can be triggered by any operation if the property is set to true and before overwriting the existing file if .Overwrite = .Prompt.

members.member:
Occurs if a file in the archive doesn`t contain a name.
Since gzip file format is oriented on the real-time process, there may be no file name in the gzip archive. There is no original file name if the data was compressed from a source other than a named file; for example, if the source was stdin on a Unix system, there is no file name. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 15.05.2010 17:01

Occurs before a new gzipped file in .OutputFilesDir is created.
If is set to false, then will be used as a name for the archive file. In that case the archive can contain only one item. In the other case, if is set to true, will be ignored and each item in the archive will be stored in a separate file in the directory specified with .OutputFilesDir. In that case the name of the archive file would be set as a name of the item in the archive plus '.gz'. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 19.05.2010 13:07

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode
member.summary: Specifies how path information will be stored for the file or directory within the archive file.
member.remarks:
StorePathMode value defines how path information will be stored for the file or directory within the archive file. If you need to store all files and directories without path you should use NoPath value. For example, AddFiles("C:\TEST\test.txt") adds file test.txt to the archive. If you will extract it by ExtractFiles("*.*") and BaseDir will be "C:\", file test.txt will be extracted to "C\":, not to "C:\TEST".
If you need to store path relative to certain directory you should set BaseDir before adding file to archive and set Options.StorePath to Relative. In this case if you will set BaseDir to "C:\" and call AddFiles("C:\TEST\test.txt") the file test.txt will be stored as "TEST\test.txt" within the archive. If you will extract it by ExtractFiles("*.*") it will be extracted to "C:\TEST\test.txt", not to "C:\" as in previous example.
If you need to store full path you should set Options.StorePath to FullPath. Previous example will store test.txt within the archive file as "\TEST\test.txt" and file will be extracted to disk specified by BaseDir.
If you need to store absolute path with drive you should set Options.StorePath to FullPathWithDrive. Previous AddFiles example will store test.txt within the archive file as "C:\TEST\test.txt" and the file will be extracted to disk using stored absolute path regardless of BaseDir.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode.NoPath
member.summary: No path information stored.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode.RelativePath
member.summary: Path information stored relatively BaseDir.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode.FullPath
member.summary: Path information stored relatively disk specified by BaseDir.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode.FullPathWithDrive
member.summary: Absolute path with drive letter stored. Non-standard extension of PKZip format.

member.summary: Allocate a single, large array and then provide sections of this array to callers. Callers are provided with instances of (which simply contain a single address value, representing a location in the large array).
member.remarks: Note that in most cases fields are used rather than properties for performance reasons (for example, is a field rather than a property).

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.PPMd.Model.PpmContext.FirstState
member.summary: The first PPM state associated with the PPM context.

remarks.para: The first PPM state overlaps this PPM context instance (the SummaryFrequency and Statistics members of PpmContext use 6 bytes and so can therefore fit into the space used by the Symbol, Frequency and Successor members of PpmState, since they also add up to 6 bytes).
PpmContext (SummaryFrequency and Statistics use 6 bytes) 1 NumberStatistics 1 Flags 2 SummaryFrequency 4 Statistics (pointer to PpmState) 4 Suffix (pointer to PpmContext)
PpmState (total of 6 bytes) 1 Symbol 1 Frequency 4 Successor (pointer to PpmContext)

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.PPMd.See2Context
member.summary: SEE2 (secondary escape estimation) contexts for PPM contexts with masked symbols.

remarks.para: This must be a class rather than a structure because MakeEscapeFrequency returns a See2Context instance from the see2Contexts array. The caller (for example, EncodeSymbol2) then updates the returned See2Context instance and expects the updates to be reflected in the see2Contexts array. This would not happen if this were a structure.
remarks.remarks: Note that in most cases fields are used rather than properties for performance reasons (for example, is a field rather than a property).

remarks.para: You have to use it because property is readonly.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the ArchiverOptions class with default parameters.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverOptions.Recurse
member.summary: Specifies if archive operation will search files recursively. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Recurse specifies if , , , , and methods will search files recursively. This means that if some folder meets search conditions then all files and directories within this folder will be scanned. For example, if you set Recurse to true and call AddFiles("C:\\*.*",FileAttributes.Normal) all files and folders located on disk C: will be added to the archive.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverOptions.StorePath
member.summary: Defines how path information will be stored for the file or directory within the archive file. The default value is .RelativePath.
member.remarks: This option applies to , , methods.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverOptions.ShareMode
member.summary: Specifies how the files being added to the archive will be opened for simultaneous access. The default value is FileShare.ReadWrite.
member.remarks: Set this option before calling , or .

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverOptions.Overwrite
member.summary: Specifies whether extracted files will overwrite existing files. The default value is .Always.
member.remarks: Set this option before calling , , or .

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverOptions.CreateDirs
member.summary: Specifies whether to create folders when extracting an archive. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Set CreateDirs to true if you need to extract files with creating all necessary folders.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverOptions.ReplaceReadOnly
member.summary: Specifies whether to replace read-only files when extracting files from archive. The default value is true.
member.remarks: If ReplaceReadOnly set to true it means that all existing read-only files will be replaced with the files being extracted by .

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverOptions.SetAttributes
member.summary: Determines whether attributes stored within the archive will be applied to extracted files. The default value is true.
member.remarks: SetAttributes determines whether attributes stored within the archive will be applied to files being extracted by .

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverOptions.SearchAttr
member.summary: Specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files. For the default value see remarks.
member.remarks:
SearchAttr specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files for , , , , and methods variant without parameters.
The default value is FileAttributes.Archive | FileAttributes.Compressed | FileAttributes.Device | FileAttributes.Directory | FileAttributes.Encrypted | FileAttributes.Hidden | FileAttributes.Normal | FileAttributes.NotContentIndexed | FileAttributes.Offline | FileAttributes.ReadOnly | FileAttributes.ReparsePoint | FileAttributes.SparseFile | FileAttributes.System | FileAttributes.Temporary

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiverOptions.FlushBuffers
member.summary: Specifies whether the file buffers are flushed after archive file modification and after extracting files from archive. The default value is true.

members.member:
File header for individual file in the tar archive.
Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

Pathname, stored as a null-terminated string. Early tar implementations only stored regular files (including hardlinks to those files). One common early convention used a trailing "/" character to indicate a directory name, allowing directory permissions and owner information to be archived and restored.
The name of the file. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

Group id of owner, as octal numbers in ASCII.
The group id. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

Group name, as null-terminated ASCII strings. These should be used in preference to the gid values when they are set and the corresponding names exist on the system.
The name of the group. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

Gets the size of the header in bytes.
The size of the header. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

Gets or sets the last modification time.
The last modification. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

File mode, stored as an octal number in ASCII.
The mode. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

Size of file, as octal number in ASCII. For regular files only, this indicates the amount of data that follows the header. In particular, this field was ignored by early tar implementations when extracting hardlinks. Modern writers should always store a zero length for hardlink entries.
The size in bytes. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

User id of owner, as octal numbers in ASCII.
The user id. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

User name, as null-terminated ASCII strings. These should be used in preference to the uid value when they are set and the corresponding names exist on the system.
The name of the user. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 20.04.2010 15:44

Gets or sets the type flag.
The type flag. Author - Osintsev Dmitri (outsourcer Singularis Lab) Modification - 13.05.2010 14:25

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarForge.FindFirst(ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarArchiveItem@)
member.overloads: Finds files stored within the archive.
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using and properties.
member.remarks:
Use FindFirst and FindNext to find files stored inside the open archive file. FindFirst returns true if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
After calling FindFirst parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.
FindFirst variant with single parameter uses , and .SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from delete operation.
member.returns: true if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns false.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarForge.FindFirst(System.String,ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarArchiveItem@)
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using parameter.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.
member.returns: true if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns false.
member.remarks:
Use FindFirst and to find files stored inside the open archive file. FindFirst returns true if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
After calling FindFirst archiveItem parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. First file that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be found.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarForge.FindFirst(System.String,ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarArchiveItem@,System.IO.FileAttributes)
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using and parameters.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.
Attributes of the files to search for.
member.returns: true if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns false.
member.remarks:
Use FindFirst and FindNext to find files stored inside the open archive file. FindFirst returns true if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
After calling FindFirst parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. First file that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be found.
The searchAttributes parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarForge.FindFirst(System.String,ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarArchiveItem@,System.IO.FileAttributes,System.String)
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using , and parameters.
member.param: The directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters.
Attributes of the files to search for.
Specifies files to be excluded from the search operation.
member.returns: true if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns false.
member.remarks:
Use FindFirst and to find files stored inside the open archive file. FindFirst returns true if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
After calling FindFirst archiveItem parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. First file that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be found.
The searchAttributes parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files
The exclusionMask specifies files to be excluded from the delete operation.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarForge.FindNext(ComponentAce.Compression.Tar.TarArchiveItem@)
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive.
member.returns: FindNext returns true if there is at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false.
member.remarks:
Use FindNext to find files stored inside the open archive file. Use FindNext after calling only.
Pass ArchiveItem class found by previous calling of FindFirst or FindNext to the FindNext. After calling FindNext archiveItem parameter will contain parameters of the next found file.

member.summary: Opens or creates an archive file with the specified file access and share modes
member.remarks:
Call OpenArchive to open or create an archive file. If the file specified by the property does not exists and the parameter is set to FileMode.Create (this is by default) or the property is set to true, then OpenArchive will create and open it. OpenArchive sets to true.
Call to close the archive file.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.AddFiles
member.summary: Adds files to the archive specified by and properties.
member.overloads: Adds files to the archive.
member.remarks:
Use AddFiles to add files to the open archive file. If you need to delete backupFileStream files, use instead of AddFiles. If .Recurse is set to true, AddFiles will search files recursively.
AddFiles variant without parameters uses , and .SearchAttr properties to specify search conditions and to exclude files from add operation.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "C:\TEST\*.*" specifies all files in the C:\TEST directory. All files that meets fileMask and searchAttributes will be added to the archive.
The searchAttributes parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.
The exclusionMask specifies files to be excluded from the add operation.
If some errors occurs an exception will be raised. Write an event handler to perform your own error handling.
If you need to change the name of the added file, use event handler.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.FindFirst(ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiveItem@)
member.overloads: Finds files stored within the archive.
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using and properties.
member.remarks:
Use FindFirst and FindNext to find files stored inside the open archive file. FindFirst returns true if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns false. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
After calling FindFirst parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.
FindFirst variant with single parameter uses , and .SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from delete operation.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. First file that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be found.
The searchAttributes parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files
The exclusionMask specifies files to be excluded from the delete operation.
member.returns: true if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns false.

member.name: E:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.OnRequestBlankVolume
member.summary: Occurs when next volume should be inserted while writing a multi-volume archive.
member.remarks: Write an OnRequestBlankVolume event handler to perform asking the user for inserting a blank volume. Also you can override default file name for the new volume. Use cancel parameter to abort current operation.

member.name: E:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.OnRequestFirstVolume
member.summary: Occurs when first volume should be inserted while extracting or testing a multi-volume archive.
member.remarks: Write an OnRequestFirstVolume event handler to perform asking the user for inserting a first volume of the multi-volume archive. See also and events. Also you can override default file name for this volume. Use cancel parameter to abort current operation.

member.name: E:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.OnRequestLastVolume
member.summary: Occurs when last volume should be inserted while extracting or testing a multi-volume archive.
member.remarks: Write an OnRequestLastVolume event handler to perform asking the user for inserting a last volume of the multi-volume archive. See also and events. Also you can override default file name for this volume. Use cancel parameter to abort current operation.

member.name: E:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.OnRequestMiddleVolume
member.summary: Occurs when middle volume should be inserted while extracting or testing a multi-volume archive.
member.remarks: Write an OnRequestMiddleVolume event handler to perform asking the user for inserting a middle volume of the multi-volume archive. See also and events. VolumeNumber specifies a number of the volume that should be inserted. Also you can override default file name for this volume. Use cancel parameter to abort current operation.

member.name: E:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.OnDiskFull
member.summary: Occurs when current volume for multi-disk spanned archive is full.
member.remarks: Write an OnDiskFull event handler to ask user to insert disk with sufficient free space for writing a multi-disk spanned archive. Also you can override default file name for this volume using volumeFileName. Use cancel parameter to abort current operation.

member.name: E:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.OnProcessVolumeFailure
member.summary: Occurs in case of failure of the current operation.
member.remarks: Write an OnProcessVolumeFailure event handler to perform some specific actions when archive operation fails. OnProcessVolumeFailure event is triggered by , , , , or if any file error occurs in the listed methods. If you will not specify event handler for OnProcessVolumeFailure any error will raise an exception.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.Comment
member.summary: Specifies the comment of the archive file.
member.remarks:
Use this property to set or get the comment of archive file.
To set comment for each file in archive use method.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the algorithm to use to encrypt archive items. The default value is .None.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.OpenCorruptedArchives
member.summary: Specifies whether the corrupted archives can be opened. The default value is true.
member.remarks:
OpenCorruptedArchives specifies whether to allow opening corrupted archives.
When this property is false, an event will be triggered when corrupted archive is being opened, otherwise the corrupted archive is opened.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.ExtractCorruptedFiles
member.summary: Specifies whether the partially corrupted files can be extracted from damaged archive. The default value is false.
member.remarks: ExtractCorruptedFiles specifies whether to allow extracting partially corrupted files from damaged archive file. When this property is false, an exception is raised when corrupted file is being extracted, otherwise the file is extracted without error messages.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Specifies the compression algorithm to use to compress archive items. The default value is .Deflate.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Specifies the compression level used for archive updating (None, Fastest, Normal, Max). The default value is .Fastest.
member.remarks:
This property determines compression level for adding, moving or updating files. If you need only to store files, set CompressionLevel to None.
Set CompressionLevel to desired value before adding, moving or updating files.
The CompressionLevel and properties influence each other. Setting one automatically determines value for the other.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.CompressionMode
member.summary: Specifies the compression level used for archive updating (from 0 to 9).
member.remarks:
This property determines compression level for adding, moving or updating files. The correct values are integer numbers in range 0-9. Maximum value of CompressionMode corresponds to slow compression and best compression rate. The zero value means that files will not be compressed. If you need only to store files, set CompressionMode to 0.
Set CompressionMode to desired value before adding, moving or updating files.
The CompressionMode and properties influence each other. Setting one automatically determines value for the other. Use CompressionMode for finer control of compression level.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.Password
member.summary: Specifies the password for files stored within the archive.
member.remarks: Set this property before adding, moving, updating, extracting or testing encrypted files.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.TempDir
member.summary: Specifies a temporary directory to use during archiving operations.
member.remarks:
TempDir is used by ZipForge to store temporary files created by archive updating operations or method.
If this property is the empty string, the system's temporary directory will be used.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.SpanningMode
member.summary: Describes how the archive file will be stored on disk. The default value is .None.
member.remarks: SpanningMode determines how the archive file will be stored on disk: as a single file, as multiple files or it will be stored on removable disks. property determines how the archive file will be splitted or spanned.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.SpanningOptions
member.summary: Specifies how the archive file will be splitted or spanned.
member.remarks: SpanningOptions property determines how the archive file will be splitted or spanned.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.SFXStub
member.summary: Specifies the file name of the executable stub.
member.remarks:
Use SFXStub to specify the executable stub before creating self-extracting (SFX) archive by OpenArchive(FileMode.Create) or by calling . If SFXStub is not set or set to not existing file when the method is called, then an exception will be raised.
If you need to create multi-disk spanned or splitted self-extractable archive you should set SFXStub and call with Create mode. Do not use MakeSFX for spanned or splitted archives.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.NoCompressionMasks
member.summary: Specifies masks for files that will be stored without compression.
member.remarks:
NoCompressionMasks are used for overloaded versions without parameters of , , , , and methods to store certain files without compression. This property should contain list of excluded directories and file names including wildcard characters. For example, "C:\\TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the 'C:\TEST' directory.
property specifies files that should be included into the operation, excluding files specified by .

member.remarks: Write an OnExtractFile event handler to override default file name or change its attributes before extracting. The event is called when is called.

member.summary: Occurs when file is being stored into the archive.

member.summary: Specifies how the archive file will be stored on disk.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningMode.None
member.summary: The archive will be stored as a single file.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningMode.Spanning
member.summary: The archive file will be stored on removable disks.

member.summary: The archive will be stored as multiple files.

member.summary: Describes how the archive file will be splitted or spanned.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the SpanningOptions class with default parameters.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.Assign(System.Object)
member.summary: Allows to copy all options from another object in one operation.
member.param: The object to copy settings from.

remarks.para: You have to use it because property is readonly.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.AdvancedNaming
member.summary: Determines how the archive volumes will be named. The default value is true.
member.remarks:
If AdvancedNaming is set to true then archive volumes will be named like archive_001.zip, archive_002.zip, ... ,archive_999.zip.
If AdvancedNaming is set to false and SpanningMode is set to smSpanning then archive volumes will be named like archive.zip on each removable disk.
If AdvancedNaming is set to false and SpanningMode is set to smSplitting then archive volumes will be named like archive.z01, archive.z02, ... , archive.z99.
You can also specify custom name for each volume using event handler.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.FirstVolumeSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of first volume in bytes. The default value is 0.
member.remarks: The FirstVolumeSize specifies the size of first volume, minimum blockSizeToDecompress is 64 Kb. If the FirstVolumeSize is set to 0 the blockSizeToDecompress of the first volume will be the same as other volumes and will be defined by value.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.VolumeSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the volumes for archive splitting or spanning. The default value is .AutoDetect.
member.remarks: The VolumeSize specifies the size of the volumes for archive splitting or spanning. If the VolumeSize is set to Custom, then will be used.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.CustomVolumeSize
member.summary: Specifies the custom blockSizeToDecompress of the volumes for archive splitting or spanning.
member.remarks: The CustomVolumeSize specifies the custom blockSizeToDecompress of the volumes for archive splitting or spanning. This parameter can be used only when is set to Custom.

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.VolumeSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the multi-spanning archive volumes.
member.remarks: VolumeSize value specifies the size of each multi-disk archive volume. Set .VolumeSize to AutoDetect for automatic detection of the volume size (default value). You can also use Custom value and specify the volume size by setting SpanningOptions.CustomVolumeSize.

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.Zip64Mode
member.summary: Specifies a zip file format.
member.remarks:
Use Zip64Mode for creating Zip64 archives. Thus you can create archive files > 4Gb and add files > 4 Gb to the archive. Set Zip64Mode to zmAlways to add files in Zip64 format. Use zmAuto for auto-detection of the archive format depending on sizes of the files being added. zmDisabled is a default value for creating archives in normal Zip format, compatible with most of archivers.
Zip64 format is not supported by some archivers. ZipForge uses the same format as PKZip. Nevertheless we do not guarantee that it is compatible with other programs.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.Zip64Mode.Disabled
member.summary: A default value for creating archives in normal Zip format.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.Zip64Mode.Auto
member.summary: Auto-detection of the archive format depending on sizes of the files being added.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.Zip64Mode.Always
member.summary: Always create archives in Zip64 format.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.ZipForge.ZipForge.Zip64Mode
member.summary: Specifies whether to use Zip64 format to create archives over 4GB. The default value is .Auto.
member.remarks:
Use Zip64Mode for creating Zip64 archives. Thus you can create archive files > 4Gb and add files > 4 Gb to the archive. Set Zip64Mode to zmAlways to add files in Zip64 format. Use zmAuto for auto-detection of the archive format depending on sizes of the files being added. zmDisabled is a default value for creating archives in normal Zip format, compatible with most of archivers.
Zip64 format is not supported by some archivers. ZipForge.NET uses the same format as PKZip. Nevertheless we do not guarantee that it is compatible with other programs.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate.window
member.summary: Sliding Window. Input bytes are ReadPos into the second half of the Window, and move to the first half later to keep a dictionary of at least wSize bytes. With this organization, matches are limited to a distance of wSize-MAX_MATCH bytes, but this ensures that IO is always performed with a length multiple of the block size. Also, it limits the Window size to 64K, which is quite useful on MSDOS. To do: use the user input buffer as sliding Window.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate.window_size
member.summary: Actual size of Window: 2*wSize, except when the user input buffer is directly used as sliding Window.

member.summary: Link to older string with same hash index. To limit the size of this array to 64K, this link is maintained only for the last 32K strings. An index in this array is thus a Window index modulo 32K.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate.lit_bufsize
member.summary: Size of match buffer for literals/lengths. There are 4 reasons for limiting lit_bufsize to 64K: - frequencies can be kept in 16 bit counters - if compression is not successful for the first block, all input data is still in the Window so we can still emit a stored block even when input comes from standard input. (This can also be done for all blocks if lit_bufsize is not greater than 32K.) - if compression is not successful for a file smaller than 64K, we can even emit a stored file instead of a stored block (saving 5 bytes). This is applicable only for zip (not gzip or zlib). - creating new Huffman trees less frequently may not provide fast adaptation to changes in the input data statistics. (Take for example a binary file with poorly compressible code followed by a highly compressible string table.) Smaller buffer sizes give fast adaptation but have of course the overhead of transmitting trees more frequently. - I can't count above 4

member.summary: Adds a byte to the buffer

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate._tr_align
member.summary: Send one empty static block to give enough lookahead for inflate. This takes 10 bits, of which 7 may remain in the bit buffer. The current inflate code requires 9 bits of lookahead. If the last two codes for the previous block (real code plus EOB) were coded on 5 bits or less, inflate may have only 5+3 bits of lookahead to decode the last real code. In this case we send two empty static blocks instead of one. (There are no problems if the previous block is stored or fixed.) To simplify the code, we assume the worst case of last real code encoded on one bit only.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate._tr_tally(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Save the match info and tally the frequency counts. Return true if the current block must be flushed.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate.compress_block(System.Int16[],System.Int16[])
member.summary: Send the block data compressed using the given Huffman trees

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate.set_data_type
member.summary: Set the data type to ASCII or BINARY, using a crude approximation: binary if more than 20% of the bytes are <= 6 or >= 128, ascii otherwise. IN assertion: the fields freq of dyn_ltree are set and the total of all frequencies does not exceed 64K (to fit in an int on 16 bit machines).

member.summary: Flush the bit buffer, keeping at most 7 bits in it.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate.bi_windup
member.summary: Flush the bit buffer and align the output on a byte boundary

member.summary: Copy without compression as much as possible from the input stream, return the current block state. This function does not insert new strings in the dictionary since uncompressible data is probably not useful. This function is used only for the level=0 compression option. NOTE: this function should be optimized to avoid extra copying from Window to Pending_buf.

member.summary: Send a stored block

member.summary: Determine the best encoding for the current block: dynamic trees, static trees or store, and output the encoded block to the zip file.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate.fill_window
member.summary:
Fill the Window when the lookahead becomes insufficient. Updates strstart and lookahead.
IN assertion: lookahead less than MIN_LOOKAHEAD OUT assertions: strstart less than or equal to window_size-MIN_LOOKAHEAD At least one byte has been ReadPos, or _avail_in == 0; reads are performed for at least two bytes (required for the zip translate_eol option -- not supported here).

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate.deflate_fast(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compress as much as possible from the input stream, return the current block state. This function does not perform lazy evaluation of matches and inserts new strings in the dictionary only for unmatched strings or for short matches. It is used only for the fast compression options.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate.deflate_slow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as above, but achieves better compression. We use a lazy evaluation for matches: a match is finally adopted only if there is no better match at the next Window position.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Inflate.inflateSyncPoint(ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZStream)
member.summary: Returns true if inflate is currently at the End of a block generated by Z_SYNC_FLUSH or Z_FULL_FLUSH. This function is used by one PPP implementation to provide an additional safety check. PPP uses Z_SYNC_FLUSH but removes the length bytes of the resulting empty stored block. When decompressing, PPP checks that at the End of input packet, inflate is waiting for these length bytes.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Tree.d_code(System.Int32)
member.summary: Mapping from a distance to a distance code. dist is the distance - 1 and must not have side effects. _dist_code[256] and _dist_code[257] are never used.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Tree.gen_bitlen(ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate)
member.summary: Compute the optimal bit lengths for a tree and update the total bit length for the current block. IN assertion: the fields freq and dad are set, heap[heap_max] and above are the tree nodes sorted by increasing frequency. OUT assertions: the field count is set to the optimal bit length, the array bl_count contains the frequencies for each bit length. The length opt_len is updated; static_len is also updated if stree is not null.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Tree.build_tree(ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Deflate)
member.summary: Construct one Huffman tree and assigns the code bit strings and lengths. Update the total bit length for the current block. IN assertion: the field freq is set for all tree elements. OUT assertions: the fields count and code are set to the optimal bit length and corresponding code. The length opt_len is updated; static_len is also updated if stree is not null. The field max_code is set.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.Tree.gen_codes(System.Int16[],System.Int32,System.Int16[])
member.summary: Generate the codes for a given tree and bit counts (which need not be optimal). IN assertion: the array bl_count contains the bit length statistics for the given tree and the field count is set for all tree elements. OUT assertion: the field code is set for all tree elements of non zero code length.

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZLibCompressionLevel
member.summary: Some constants for specifying compression levels. Methods which takes a compression level as a parameter expects an integer value from 0 to 9. You can either specify an integer value or use constants for some most widely used compression levels.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZLibCompressionLevel.Z_NO_COMPRESSION
member.summary: No compression should be used at all.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZLibCompressionLevel.Z_BEST_SPEED
member.summary: Minimal compression, but greatest speed.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZLibCompressionLevel.Z_BEST_COMPRESSION
member.summary: Maximum compression, but slowest.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZLibCompressionLevel.Z_DEFAULT_COMPRESSION
member.summary: Select default compression level (good compression, good speed).

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.CompressionStrategy
member.summary: Compression strategies. The strategy parameter is used to tune the compression algorithm. The strategy parameter only affects the compression ratio but not the correctness of the compressed output even if it is not set appropriately.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.CompressionStrategy.Z_FILTERED
member.summary: This strategy is designed for filtered data. Data which consists of mostly small values, with random distribution should use Z_FILTERED. With this strategy, less string matching is performed.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.CompressionStrategy.Z_HUFFMAN_ONLY
member.summary: Z_HUFFMAN_ONLY forces Huffman encoding only (no string match)

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.CompressionStrategy.Z_DEFAULT_STRATEGY
member.summary: The default strategy is the most commonly used. With this strategy, string matching and huffman compression are balanced.

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.FlushStrategy
member.summary: Flush strategies

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.FlushStrategy.Z_NO_FLUSH
member.summary: Do not internalFlush data, but just write data as normal to the output buffer. This is the normal way in which data is written to the output buffer.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.FlushStrategy.Z_PARTIAL_FLUSH
member.summary: Obsolete. You should use Z_SYNC_FLUSH instead.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.FlushStrategy.Z_SYNC_FLUSH
member.summary: All pending output is flushed to the output buffer and the output is aligned on a byte boundary, so that the decompressor can get all input data available so far.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.FlushStrategy.Z_FULL_FLUSH
member.summary: All output is flushed as with Z_SYNC_FLUSH, and the compression state is reset so that decompression can restart from this point if previous compressed data has been damaged or if random access is desired. Using Z_FULL_FLUSH too often can seriously degrade the compression. ZLib_InflateSync will locate points in the compression string where a full has been performed.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.FlushStrategy.Z_FINISH
member.summary: Notifies the module that the input has now been exhausted. Pending input is processed, pending output is flushed and calls return with Z_STREAM_END if there was enough output space.

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZLibStream

summary.para: This class represents the Deflate algorithm, an industry standard algorithm for lossless file compression and decompression. It uses a combination of the LZ77 algorithm and Huffman coding. Data can be produced or consumed, even for an arbitrarily long, sequentially presented input data stream, using only previously bound amount of intermediate storage. The format can be implemented readily in a manner not covered by patents. For more information, see RFC 1951. DEFLATE Compressed Data Format Specification version 1.3.

The compression functionality in ZLibStream is exposed as a stream. Data is read in on a byte-by-byte basis, so it is not possible to perform multiple passes to determine the best method for compressing entire files or large blocks of data.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZLibStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: The Read method allows you to read data from the ZLibStream. The method is supported for a decompression stream only ().

If the current stream is a decompression stream this method reads a block of data from the underlying stream (the one passed to the constructor), decompresses it using the inflate algorithm and returns decompressed data block.

remarks.para: When calling for a compression stream this method throws the exception.
Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading.

member.param: An array of byte in which we want to decompress data. When this method returns the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the decompressed data bytes.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the decompressed data.
The maximum number of bytes to read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

summary.para: The Write method allows you to write data to the ZLibStream. The method is supported for a compression stream only ().
If the current stream is a compression stream this method reads a block of data from the , compresses it and writes to the underlying stream (the one passed to the constructor).

Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing.

member.param: An array of byte containing source data. This method copies count bytes from buffer to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

(So and may be modified, but and are unchanged.)

member.param: The windowBits parameter is the base two logarithm of the maximum window size (the size of the history buffer). It should be in the range 8..15 for this version of the library. member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZStream.inflate(ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.FlushStrategy)

summary.para: This method decompresses as much data as possible, and stops when the input buffer () becomes empty or the output buffer () becomes full. It may some introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.
The detailed semantics are as follows. performs one or both of the following actions:

list.item: Decompress more input starting at and update and accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), is updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call of .

Provide more output starting at and update and accordingly. provides as much output as possible, until there is no more input data or no more space in the output buffer (see below about the parameter).

remarks.para: Before the call of , the application should ensure that at least one of the actions is possible, by providing more input and/or consuming more output, and updating the next_* and avail_* values accordingly. The application can consume the uncompressed output when it wants, for example when the output buffer is full (avail_out == 0), or after each call of . If returns and with zero , it must be called again after making room in the output buffer because there might be more output pending.

If the parameter is set to , flushes as much output as possible to the output buffer. The flushing behavior of is not specified for values of the parameter other than and , but the current implementation actually flushes as much output as possible anyway.

should normally be called until it returns or an error. However if all decompression is to be performed in a single step (a single call of inflate), the parameter should be set to . In this case all pending input is processed and all pending output is flushed ; must be large enough to hold all the uncompressed data. (The size of the uncompressed data may have been saved by the compressor for this purpose.) The next operation on this stream must be to deallocate the decompression state. The use of is never required, but can be used to inform that a faster routine may be used for the single call.

If a preset dictionary is needed at this point (see ), sets strm-adler to the adler32 checksum of the dictionary chosen by the compressor and returns ; otherwise it sets strm->adler to the adler32 checksum of all output produced so far (that is, bytes) and returns , or an error code as described below. At the end of the stream, ) checks that its computed adler32 checksum is equal to that saved by the compressor and returns only if the checksum is correct.

member.returns: returns if some progress has been made (more input processed or more output produced), if the end of the compressed data has been reached and all uncompressed output has been produced, if a preset dictionary is needed at this point, if the input data was corrupted (input stream not conforming to the ZLib format or incorrect adler32 checksum), if the stream structure was inconsistent (for example if or was null), if there was not enough memory, if no progress is possible or if there was not enough room in the output buffer when is used. In the case, the application may then call to look for a good compression block.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZStream.inflateEnd
member.summary: All dynamically allocated data structures for this stream are freed. This function discards any unprocessed input and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: inflateEnd returns if success, if the stream state was inconsistent. In the error case, msg may be set but then points to a static string (which must not be deallocated).

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSync
member.summary: Skips invalid compressed data until a full flush point (see the description of deflate with Z_FULL_FLUSH) can be found, or until all available input is skipped. No output is provided.
member.returns: returns if a full flush point has been found, if no more input was provided, if no flush point has been found, or if the stream structure was inconsistent. In the success case, the application may save the current current value of which indicates where valid compressed data was found. In the error case, the application may repeatedly call , providing more input each time, until success or end of the input data.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Libs.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the decompression dictionary from the given uncompressed byte sequence. This function must be called immediately after a call of if this call returned . The dictionary chosen by the compressor can be determined from the Adler32 value returned by this call of . The compressor and decompresser must use exactly the same dictionary.
member.returns: inflateSetDictionary returns if success, if a parameter is invalid (such as null dictionary) or the stream state is inconsistent, if the given dictionary doesn't match the expected one (incorrect Adler32 value). inflateSetDictionary does not perform any decompression: this will be done by subsequent calls of .
